author: Taylor Langston
title: Morris says penalties were "inexcusable"
text:
Morris says penalties were "inexcusable" Posted: 
The Red Raiders are finished licking their wounds following a 63-27 beat down in Norman on Saturday. 
Sophomore quarterback Patrick Mahomes would finish the game 26-40 with 1 touchdown and four interceptions. 
Kingsbury said the tipped balls that resulted in some of those turnovers were largely in part to a good defensive teams that made plays. 
He credited a good defense more than errors on the Red Raider's part, but admitted there was a lack of rhythm. 
The Red Raiders will continue the trend of facing strong defenses this week with Oklahoma State, who boasts one of the strongest pass rushes in the conference. 
"Probably two of the best defensive ends in the league right now," Offensive Coordinator Eric Morris says. "Sterns is probably one of the best tacklers, their corners are good and have played a lot of football. I think they're really good." 
Morris went on to say that the penalties from Saturday were "inexcusable." 
The Red Raiders ended the day with 7 penalties for 68 yards. 
"It's just within yourself," Micah Awe says. "It's simple things, that's all it is. Having accountability within yourself." 
Awe spoke about his frustrations of failing to stop the run this season, taking responsibility as a defensive leader. "I feel like it comes directly back on me, honestly. I put a lot of pressure on myself and I feel like if we can't stop the run, it's probably my fault and I take responsibility." 
Junior offensive lineman Baylen Brown went down against Oklahoma and would return to the sideline on crutches. His parents told KCBD he would need an MRI and Kingsbury announced to the media today that he will not need surgery. 
Brown will attempt to get back on his feet this week against Oklahoma State.
